intro: Hazardia cana, commonly known as the slender hazardia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. Its yellow to reddish flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hazardia cana is often found in sagebrush communities and is adapted to arid environments.
